snippet: The justices, voting 8 to 1, reinstated a job discrimination lawsuit filed against Abercrombie & Fitch, saying the company had acted improperly.
abstract: Supreme Court votes 8-1 to reinstate job discrimination lawsuit filed by Muslim woman Samantha Elauf against Abercrombie & Fitch, which refused to hire her because she wears a head scarf; Justice Antonin Scalia delivers ruling, saying motive behind company's decision was clearly related to Elauf's religion and therefore in violation of federal employment discrimination law.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The justices, voting 8 to 1, reinstated a job discrimination lawsuit filed against Abercrombie & Fitch, saying the company had acted improperly.

headline.main: Muslim Woman Denied Job Over Head Scarf Wins in Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule Against Retailer in Clash Over Applicant’s Head Scarf
